Question: aequus, aequa, aequum
Answer: level, even; calm; equal, just; favorable;
Name: aequus, aequa, aequum

Question: cēterī, cēterae, cētera
Answer: pl. the remaining, the rest, the other, all the others
Name: cēterī, cēterae, cētera

Question: dūrus, dūram dūrum
Answer: hard, harsh, rough, stern, unfeeling, hardy, tough, difficult
Name: dūrus, dūram dūrum

Question: gravis, grave
Answer: heavy, weighty; serious, important; severe grievous
Name: gravis, grave

Question: hūmānus, hūmāna, hūmānum
Answer: pertaining to man, human; humane, kind; refined, cultivated
Name: hūmānus, hūmāna, hūmānum

Question: līberālis, līberāle
Answer: of, relating to a free person; worthy of a free man, decent, liberal; generous
Name: līberālis, līberāle

Question: necesse
Answer: indecl. adj. used as a nom. or acc., necessary, inevitable; often necesse est + infin., it is necessary (to)
Name: necesse

Question: quantus, quanta, quantum
Answer: how large, how great, how much
Name: quantus, quanta, quantum

Question: quoddam
Answer: gen. cuiusdam, dat. cuidam, etc.; a certain, some
Name: quoddam

Question: quot
Answer: indecl. adj.; how many, as many as
Name: quot

Question: suus, sua, suum
Answer: his own, her own, its own, their own
Name: suus, sua, suum

Question: tantus, tanta, tantum
Answer: so large, so great, of such a size
Name: tantus, tanta, tantum

Question: tot
Answer: indecl. adj. so many, as many
Name: tot

Question: urbānus, urbāna, urbānum
Answer: of the city, urban; urbane, elegant
Name: urbānus, urbāna, urbānum
